Reviews.Title: “not the best but better than ineernational inn! ok for the money ! close to mia international !”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel just for one day before my flight to italy this monday. i stayed the night before in international inn which was sooooooooooooo bad i would never ever go.not even for free. i found this one on despegar.com ,booked it at 71 plus tax and was really positively surprised. i dont know why people rated the midtown inn as worste of worst etc. no need to.really njot. friendly guy at the reception. rooms dark but spacious and big beds with old tv sets (nothing is perfect). perfectly located in front of a tropical pollo (at least some food) ,a wendys (haha closed at 10 pm) and an even worse taco bell which has nothing whatsoever to do with mexican food :) okay back to the inn. breakfast included but not abundant.just some juice,doughnuts and cereals. oh yes coffee. no possibility to seat and full with clumsy brazilian tourists who spill everything they hold in hands .whatever. the place is okay for the money and by far not bad. to be recommended,really. okay it is not the w or setai but miami in springbreak is so awful you have to be grateful if not everone joins the muggers and thieves like international inn or southbeach hotels. good value for money !

Reviews.Title: “Checked in at 11 pm, checked out at 11.10 pm”
Reviews.Author: Curi0usJ
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel just yesterday and I am already reviewing it to make sure no one does the same MISTAKE we did!!!! This was the most disgusting room we had ever been at. We were a party of 4 adults and 2 kids and wanted something budget so booked this inn through easytobook.com. We could barely stand the stinch of the apartment, it was very old, the bathroom was small and dirty, and worst, the beds were stinking and dusty. The location was so dodgy too and this was definitely not a place for families. I would rather have slept in the car!!! Anyways, we checked out (or escaped) the hotel within 10 minutes and did not even bother to get a refund. To hell with Midtown Inn!

Reviews.Title: “It the worst of the worst”
Reviews.Author: Josh J
Reviews.Content: This is the list of wrong thing with this place: -Durty towel and just one big towel by family. -A lot of Moulds around the bath. -Two of lamps was broking -Very Noisy -Juice machine for the breakfast was broken. -Breakfast was minimum -Parking was to small -A lot of the door was in very bad condition like somebody try to force the door. -Didn't sleep much, bad area, a lot of beggar on the street. -Nothing to do in this area -No elevator

Reviews.Title: “NO ELEVATOR”
Reviews.Author: Jane A
Reviews.Content: I booked through Expedia, it was my price range and it was near the Hilton where a family reunion was taking place. I didn't think of calling the hotel and asking if they had an elevator, I assumed they did. I got there and I was assigned one of the two rooms on the 3rd floor. I asked where the elevator was and the surly black desk clerk said " sorry, no elevator" (he didn't look sorry.) He also said there were no other rooms. So I lugged my heavy suitcase to the 3rd floor. I had requested a non-smoking and my res said it was - but I noticed a burn mark on the chair and also a burn mark on the carpet. Other than that, it was clean - no bugs, and it didn't smell "smoky" however it wasn't designated as non-smoking. The remote for the TV didn't work - oh well, at least the TV worked. The A/C worked, hair dryer, microwave, and iron worked. The bathroom and bathtub were clean looking, but the strips on the bathtub were old and worn. I took a shower - it was okay. There were people swimming in the pool, they looked like they were enjoying themselves. There is a Walgreens nearby, also several fast food restaurants. You can walk 2 blocks east and look at the water. Bus service is good, however there is no place good to walk at night. If you want both night life and day life, the best place to stay is South Beach. I only stayed at the Midtown to be near the Hilton where my family reunion was. All in all it's an okay place for the money, but if you want a room on the first floor, you should call up and request it. One thing about the 3rd floor, at least it was quiet, I don't know about the rest of the place.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay for the weekend”
Reviews.Author: jenocafa
Reviews.Content: We were 4 adults staying at this little hotel and we will add the following comments: - Although It is not a 3+ hotel, we found it very comfortable. So do not expect any those fancy things you would have in 3+ hotels. - It has a great location! Near Miami port and downtown. There are some buses stops on the same hotel street that can get you to those places. - If you have a car to move around, then Miami Beach is just 10 mins. away! - The breakfast is not the one we expected and the period of time to have it is very short 7am to 9am, so if you go wake up late then I suppose you will not make it.

Reviews.Title: “Good cost benefits”
Reviews.Author: Ugioni
Reviews.Content: Low cost hotel, good to sleep. Has good beds and shawer. But the room is a litros dirt. I stayed twice.

Reviews.Title: “30+ Bed Bug bites”
Reviews.Author: misslucyKW
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for one night in room #404. I woke up the next day with over 30 bed bug bites. I have about 10 on each elbow, 10 on my back and a few more on my legs and lower back. They are extremely itchy, red and swollen. Ive been bitten by bed bugs one other time in my life so I know they are bed bug bites. I feel absolutely disguising. I don't suggest anyone stay here, especially anyone with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “"Great Value"”
Reviews.Author: susieq1941
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here the past 3 cruises & guess what? already booked for cruise #4 here.this is a great value of a hotel.I been cruising since 2003 but came by car,I found this hotel & great service,I decided to travel by Amtrak & they have a great shuttle service I decided to stick with this caring hotel & great shuttle services. Very conveniently located for all your needs.They are very hard working courteous people dedicated to making you comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY not worth the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: FromMSP
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've stayed at in my adult life. While it may be close to the cruise boat terminal, I highly recommend either paying more for a nicer hotel or stay at an airport hotel. The port is is a $24 cab ride from the airport. The hotel was so filthy. The carpet was full of burn stains and gum. I wiped the mold and dirt off the bathroom walls for the next person. I'm sure it ruined the washcloth. We got three small towels that were see through. Out bathroom light didn't work. The pool was so dirty and full of gunk that, you could probably walk across it. I didn't know until we were there, the hotel had had bedbugs. We were under the impression it was close to the water, which it was not. It was about a $15-20 cab ride to any nice areas of Miami. We didn't dare eat the free breakfast but there was a McDonalds and other restaurants across the street. The only good thing about this hotel was that it was within walking distance to a shopping center and Target. We were traveling with two other families and I felt so bad since I was the one who suggested we stay here. I could go on and on, but seriously, DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Area - We had a disappointing end however”
Reviews.Author: manitoba_merv
Reviews.Content: We booked a four night stay at this hotel to attend the Miami Boat Show and were travelling with our two young children. First impressions were good, the facility seemed good for the value, the location was convenient, the room size was large. The rooms were basic and could use a good cleaning as they had kind of a musty smell and the carpets were dark and dank. The bathtubs are pretty dingy so we opted to shower the kids. The fridge was not working on arrival however it was promptly fixed after we called. The staff were friendly and accomodating. I went to use the coin laundry facilities however the washer would not work so I went to the front desk and he assisted me in using the hotel's industrial machines which was greatly appreciated. The continental breakfast was basic but did the trick (2 varieties of cereal, muffins, bagels, donuts, pastry). Would have like to have use of a toaster for the bagels and perhaps some toast. Rooms were cleaned daily and they even made up our youngest son's playpen the one day which I thought was cute. We were in a unit that was facing the road so it was pretty noisy and there was road construction taking place. The disappointing moment came at the end of our stay. I went to wake my son up in the morning on our last day and when I flipped back the sheets there were several bed bugs (large and small crawling around). On further investigation I noticed that there was a lot of excrement in both the beds and smears of blood towards the bottom where our feet would have been. Needless to say we were quite disgusted and happy to be leaving!! I just hope that we managed to avoid bringing any home with us!! I realize that the climate plays a big role in these issues and that even the most luxury of hotels can have these problems but clearly these bugs had been living there for quite some time and were well established. I should have done a better check of things on check-in but didn't think about it at the time. Unfortunately because of this we will not be returning to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again, service great, location great.”
Reviews.Author: Shelli39
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, location great for Bayside Marketplace and port. Ten dollar round trip for a cab to Bayside. I think fantastic to stay at the night before if leaving for a cruise. Staff extremely helpful for transportation to and from the port and friendly. Secure and reasonably priced place to leave vehicle while on cruise. Did not buy the package, did everything seperately and no problems. The continental breakfast was simple but for the price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - Cheap night before a cruise - But not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: BarneyBoMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night before our cruise. Me (43 yr old woman) and 2 teen aged boys (14 and 15). Price and shuttle is why we selected this motel. The shuttle was great and very reliable. The location was good. Person running the front desk very friendly. We ate at Five Guys for dinner about a few blocks away. My kids loved the hamburgers. A Denneys, Target, Marshalls, and Walgreens are close by- all walking distance. My son loved the shower. I bought a can of lysol at the Target and sprayed down the room - the whole room including the bedding, pillows, door knobs. I am sure as the weather becomes more humid and hot, critters will appear. At this time of year (April) , I did not see any, but our door when shut had a large gap opening at the bottom that could let a fair large critter in. I blocked the door with furniture while sleeping (or trying to sleep). None of us had a good night sleep. Uncomfortable beds, noisy. For the price and convenience of the shuttle, I would stay again before a cruise - with my own pillow and body bag as long as I was with my boys or husband. I would not recommend it to a single female or family with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a night before cruise”
Reviews.Author: teja_sripathi
Reviews.Content: This place has really good location, having almost all the food courts right across the street,very close to downtown and Miami beach. The staff is really friendly....the front desk guy(Nichols) is really helpful..he helped us to plan our two day stay ...the shuttle service was really wonderful...all in time...I will be back next year guys

Reviews.Title: “Do Not....I Repeat...Do Not Stay Here!!! Trust Me!!”
Reviews.Author: topmodel3987
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in May 2008 (memorial day weekend) but almost two years later I was compelled to write a review because my stay was simply AWFUL!! It began once we checked in and the rooms were extremely hot and stuffy, the pool looked as if the water had not been changed in weeks either....There were roaches big as myself crawling up the wall and Shirley the housekeeper, is a complete THIEF!! If she's still working there watch out for her! I came back to the room and caught her in the act of taking money off of the nightstand in my room. She claims she thought it was her "tip"! WTF?!?!?Needless to say I couldnt wait to get outta that dump once and for all. I made the manager refund me $100 of my money after the hell I went through staying there. Take my advice...Spend an extra few bucks and stay somewehere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: julieup
Reviews.Content: I went on a cruise trip with 3 friends the day after superbowl. We had a difficult time finding a room and based on some of the reviews decided on Midtown Inn. The shuttle driver was very nice, but the hotel was dirty. One of the beds had blood on the comforter. The staff changed it out for us and apologized but that really did not cut it. The bathroom was DIRTY and the towels were terrible. Additionally, the fire alarm went off in the middle of the night! I do not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “This is a forgotten hotel unfurtunately left to go down hill”
Reviews.Author: Cam_and_Liz
Reviews.Content: I'll put this in short form. We had to change rooms because the sink H. water tap broke. The pool was ordered shut under a Florida state statuted (per the posted sign). What does that tell you about looking after the motel. We are under the fly path of the east/west runway, Miami airport. No shower towers (had to ask). Got bad reception trying to watch the Olympics on an old Zenith TV. Pillows were flat (real flat). 2 hangers ( 6 potencial) to hang your cloths up on. King sized bed in bad shape. No clock radio. Stange people in nearby roomssss.....Lock your doors. If being close to ships and airport are what you want, well ok BUT be prepard to look the other way. Suggest you ask for an exceptionally low rate to make it worth while though.$99 a night way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: susieq1941
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk,staff and shuttle service was outstanding and I plan to return next Dec.before and after my cruise & the continental breakfast was great and wonderful selection of items,everyone was very courteous and very helpful,you can see they work very hard to maintain a comfortable place for your comfort,I really enjoyed my stay.I would have stayed another day but had plans to leave that day. Come on let's help one another. Mall within walking distance,cheap eateries,very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem for budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: CanberraJarrod
Reviews.Content: Great management who helped with all requests( rooms, services and local info). The room was big with all ameneties requested ( micro, fridge etc). You will need to catch buses to get to downtown or south beach( 2 buses), but once you have worked these out it is a breeze and cheap. There are a lot of restaurants and supermarkets around the area which was very handy- and the pool was excellent. Dont be fooled by current roadworks going on out the front- we were placed in a room at the back of the hotel though. Basically for a budget traveller it was well worth the $40 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life, do not even unpack your bags”
Reviews.Author: henryMaryland
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, it is a homeless shelter. I should have gotten a clue from the dirty entrance, the folks hanging out on the porch, the dust from the roadside excavation and the surly dude at the front desk. I demanded my money back!! There was scum in the bathtub, the towels are a shade between grey and black and the closets are a makeshift coffin like contraption. Anyone who gives this place even an ok rating is out of their mind. This place should not even be listed as an inn. I refused to take my bags in, much less to unpack and sleep. I called around, got a room at another hotel even paying twice the rate and hauled out of there. Even the memories, give me creeps!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room and wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: londonguy83
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights at the Midtown Inn for a very good price and found it to be a pleasant surprise. The rooms were clean and staff was friendly. The most important part was the location and its accessibility to all of the major areas of Miami. Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short stay”
Reviews.Author: TeamAntioch
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and decided to give this place a try and glad we did. We needed a place to lay our heads for one night before taking off on cruise. Location was great, lots of restaurants within a block or two, hotel was clean, rooms are large and staff very friendly. I would stay here again the next time we book a cruise out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient for Ultra Music Festival”
Reviews.Author: carli15
Reviews.Content: This was my second year going to the Ultra Music Festival held at Bicentennial Park in downtown Miami, and this was totally convenient. Being within walking distance saved a fortune in cabs, and the area was safe and well-lit. Rooms were clean and the hotel was also close to South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Run Down”
Reviews.Author: popelsmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on Nov. 14, 2008. We purchased a package that included free transportation from the cruise terminal and a free shuttle to the airport the next morning. The staff was very accomodating. I called the hotel to get a ride from the cruise pier and they had housekeeping get a room ready for us even though check in wasn't until the afternoon. That was nice because we had an exhausted three year old. The hotel is in a good location, but is very run down and in need of major improvements. It is located right next to a public bus stop that we used to go downtown to the Bayside Park. The bus system is very good in Miami. We were supposed to have two double beds but they gave us a king instead. I didn't complain, it was big enough for the three of us. The floors were very dirty and there was hair on the floor in the bathroom. I was a bit disgusted but we were really only there to sleep for one night. There is free wifi throughout the building and a tiny breakfast of packaged, expired foods in the morning. I suggest walking to one of the nearby restaurants, like Denny's. They have a pool that is really small, I didn't use it. The transportation included in the price makes the stay worth it, but I would pay more next time for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Management”
Reviews.Author: tayljordan
Reviews.Content: OK, they weren't the greatest. But the guy who runs it is really trying, it looks like he took it over recently and busts his butt to make sure everyone is happy. Sure, it's had better days, but it could be worse. I was also overbooked in South Beach for Memorial Day, and Midtown took me in at a great rate. They could've price gouged like every other hotel in the area (the Holiday Inn was charging $399/night) but didn't.

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGyrl8
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here because this was the only vacancy they had available in the area due to the Memorial Day holiday. The rooms are old and musty. The bathroom is a joke with an old home toilet seat. I got up this morning and saw a roach crawling along the side of the bed. I'm soo OVER it. Thankfully I only have to stay one night! Do yourself a favor and book in advance and research the hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches carried us away”
Reviews.Author: ghutch
Reviews.Content: have you ever seen that commercial where the couple get married and he takes her back to his place, to which she applies a paper bag to her face and starts to hyperventilate? yea, we lived that commercial. i could sum it all up (but i wont) by saying that when we asked if there was an elevator (dont even think you will get help with your bags) i never heard so much laughter, "hey, did you hear what they just asked? ha!!" figuring we are staying only one night prior to our cruise, we could tough it out, being from new england - no problem! so, we take a bus to south beach (which was the smartest way to travel), and upon returning we decided to retire for the evening. after taking a frigid shower (to which we complained and got the response-"i'll have somebody look into that." - yea, right!), we layed down on the bed to watch a little t.v. Well, after a couple of minutes my peripheral vision develops a severe case of roach-itis! i jumped up, wacked the bugs, told the wife to pack our bags, put the bugs in a cup and took them to the front desk. the man was very apologetic and even offered another room. yea, no thanks! expedia found us a room at the days inn on south beach within minutes, although explaining that we are going from a 3 star room to a 1 and a half! let me just say that whatever system they are using to rate these hotels is severely busted! so at 10pm we are taking the bus back over to south beach, thankfully reimbursed, yet forever scorned. do yourself a favor and spend a few extra dollars!

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: TravlerofUSA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before leaving for our cruise as well. Our room was located on the second floor of which we carried our own bags on stairs they were washing. When we asked where/if they had an elevator the employees acutally laughed at us. Our stay was short. After using the shower, WHICH ONLY HAD COLD WATER, we then noticed that there were COCKROACHS in our room. We checked out immediately and demanded a full refund!!!!! I would rather sleep on the street then ever even enter one of their rooms again.

Reviews.Title: “Feb 2004 Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Jim1857
Reviews.Content: A real horror story. I stayed here for two nights (prior to our cruise) with eight other couples. All the couples had their own rooms. My room was small, dirty & one flight up. I had booked poolside. The front desk changed it to a poolside room. The poolside room bathroom window had no glass & no screen. Soap was a small white piece (brown-stained) from age. The toilet bowl and sink never stopped running. The pillows probably were many years old. The air conditioner was icy cold but so loud you couldn't hear the T.V. I couldn't change my room because the hotel was full. The other couples had similar complaints with their rooms including a broken leg on one bed, collapsed mattress on another bed, curtains that didn't close fully for privacy, etc. We all experienced the inablilty to get fresh towels until after 5P.M. on both nights (because the hotel washing machine was broken). A total of 5 lounge chairs were around the pool for the booked-full hotel guests to use. Complaints to the front desk (in person) were unanswered. We were stuck there for 2 nights awaiting our cruise ship. Returning from my cruise vacation, I wrote to Super 8 corporation as well as the hotel directly. To date, I've received no replies. We paid about $90.00/night. I realize Super 8 is not on top of the hotel chains, but this property comes close to violating some local ordinances and/or health codes. My advice is to go for the extra bucks and stay at a better hotel in Miami.

HotelInfo.Name: Midtown Inn Miami
HotelInfo.Address: 3400 Biscayne Blvd, Miami, FL 33137
